dictionary.definition: straight-laced, stuffy
loud, annoying
loud
loud, crazy
honorable
bitterly sarcastic
funny
immature and overconfident
easily managed or controlled
a reference to a well-known person, place, event, literary work, or work of art
a deliberate exaggeration or overstatement
a form of understatement in which a thing is affirmed by stating the negative of its opposite
word choice
the physical arrangement of words in a sentence
the deliberate omission of a word or words that are readily implied by the context and by the parallel structure
an opinion or conclusion formed on the basis of incomplete information
a direct contrast of structurally parallel word grouping generally for the purpose of contrast
a form of metaphor in which a part of something is used to stand for the whole thing
a figure of speech in which the name of one object is substituted for that of another closely associated with it.
a two-word figure of speech that combines two opposing ideas
an assertion seemingly opposed to common sense, but that may yet have some truth in it
something that deviates from what is standard, normal, or expected
a question, especially one addressed to an official or organization.
a form of deductive reasoning consisting of a major premise, a minor premise, and a conclusion.
the repetition of grammatical structure
the writers attitude toward the audience and subject
saying less than is actually meant, generally in an ironic way
an explanation based upon a comparison that explains or describes on subject by pointing out its similarities to another subject
ways to study or analyze language
